citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, Western Ecological Research Center, Sequoia-Kings Canyon Field Station
citeinfo.title: Southwest U.S. Mechanically Treated Chaparral Photo Series: Cover

descript.abstract: Accurate, complete fuels data are critical for making fuel management decisions and for predicting fire behavior and fire effects. A fuel photo series is a useful reference that allows natural resource managers to quickly quantify fuel and vegetation properties by comparing on site conditions to a series of photos showing a range of calculated fuel loads within a similar vegetative community. While there are photo series available for a wide range of ecosystem types nationwide, this type of information is lacking for natural and mechanically treated chaparral. The most likely reason for this information gap is the difficulty in collecting and photographing fuels in these dense fuel types.
descript.purpose: The fuels and vegetation data accompanying this photo series were collected for a Joint Fire Science Project looking at the effects and effectiveness of mechanical treatments in chaparral. This study, which quantified fuel composition and structure, provided a unique opportunity to capture photographs of a range of treatments across a variety of chaparral types on the four southern California national forests.
descript.supplinf: Each study site consisted of a 10 Ã— 100 m treatment plot placed perpendicular to the slope and subdivided into 10 100-m2 subplots, with a 1-m2 quadrat nested in the upper left corner of each subplot. Species composition in treatments was determined by recording cover and density of individual species within each of the 1-m2 quadrats and listing additional species present in the rest of the 100-m2 subplot. Cover was visually estimated and density was either counted, or when there were more than 30 individuals in the quadrat an estimate was recorded. Final cover values were derived by summing the cover of individual species by life history trait.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

procstep.procdesc: Development of the data set by the agency / individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Native shrub cover - The percent cover of all native shrub species combined.
Native subshrub cover - The percent cover of all native subshrub species combined.
Native suffrutescent cover - The percent cover of all native suffrutescent species combined.
Native herbaceous perennial cover - The percent cover of all herbaceous perennial species combined.
Native annual cover - The percent cover of all native annual species combined.
Exotic cover - The percent cover of all exotic species combined.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
